A Step-By-Step Guide to Canada’s Provincial Nominee Program (PNP)

Immigrate to a province of your choice through Canadian Provincial Nominee Program (PNP). Here is a comprehensive guide to Canada PNP and its streams.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner content_placement=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” What is the Canadian Provincial Nominee Program (PNP)?

Prospective Indian immigrants who wish to immigrate to Canada can apply through an applicable Canadian Provincial Nominee Program. It was introduced in 1998 to evenly fulfill the population and labor requirements of all the Canadian provinces.

Canada’s Provincial Nominee Program consists of over 80 immigration programs run by different provinces and territories in Canada. This program is designed for employees who have the skills, education, and work experience to contribute to a province’s or territory’s economy.

The Government of Canada sends out a certain number of invitations chosen from the pool of Canadian Provincial Nominee Program applicants each year. These provincial programs are popular because they offer prospective immigrants a speedy route toward receiving permanent residency.

Let’s learn more about the Canada PNP Programs in this comprehensive guide.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” text_align=”left”][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][vc_column column_padding=”padding-3-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” link_url=”https://www.elaarimmigration.ca/bc-pnp-programs/” link_screen_reader=”Express Entry Page”]

British Columbia Provincial Nominee Program (BC PNP)

[/fancy_box][vc_column_text]

British Columbia’s Provincial Nominee Programs are suited for foreign nationals who possess the skills to become contributing members of the province’s workforce.

[/vc_column_text][/item][item simple_slider_bg_image_position=”default” simple_slider_overlay_strength=”0.3″ id=”1653917829629-1″ tab_id=”1653917829630-9″ title=”Item”][fancy_box box_style=”image_above_text_underline” image_url=”7225″ image_aspect_ratio=”16-9″ link_new_tab=”true” border_radius=”10px” image_loading=”default” min_height=”350″ link_url=”https://www.elaarimmigration.ca/alberta-provincial-nominee-program” link_screen_reader=”Express Entry Page”]

Alberta Advantage Immigration Program (AAIP)

[/fancy_box][vc_column_text]

The province of Alberta offers numerous Provincial Nominee Program streams. The first two are for foreign workers presently working in Alberta or those who wish to work in the province.

[/vc_column_text][/item][item simple_slider_bg_image_position=”default” simple_slider_overlay_strength=”0.3″ id=”1653917829658-0″ tab_id=”1653917829660-6″ title=”Item”][fancy_box box_style=”image_above_text_underline” image_url=”7227″ image_aspect_ratio=”16-9″ link_new_tab=”true” border_radius=”10px” image_loading=”default” min_height=”350″ link_url=”https://www.elaarimmigration.ca/manitoba-provincial-nominee-program/” link_screen_reader=”Express Entry Page”]

Manitoba Provincial Nominee Program (MPNP)

[/fancy_box][vc_column_text]

Manitoba’s PNP consists of seven streams spread across Skilled Workers, International Education, and Business Investor categories.

[/vc_column_text][/item][item simple_slider_bg_image_position=”default” simple_slider_overlay_strength=”0.3″ id=”1653917829697-8″ tab_id=”1653917829699-6″ title=”Item”][fancy_box box_style=”image_above_text_underline” image_url=”7232″ image_aspect_ratio=”16-9″ link_new_tab=”true” border_radius=”10px” image_loading=”default” min_height=”350″ link_url=”https://www.elaarimmigration.ca/ontario-provincial-nominee-program/”]

Ontario Immigration Nominee Program (OINP)

[/fancy_box][vc_column_text]

The Ontario Immigrant Nominee Program serves as Ontario’s PNP to assist foreign nationals in obtaining permanent residency.

[/vc_column_text][/item][item simple_slider_bg_image_position=”default” simple_slider_overlay_strength=”0.3″ id=”1653917830036-10″ tab_id=”1653917830037-4″ title=”Item”][fancy_box box_style=”image_above_text_underline” image_url=”7235″ image_aspect_ratio=”16-9″ link_new_tab=”true” border_radius=”10px” image_loading=”default” min_height=”350″ link_url=”https://www.elaarimmigration.ca/Saskatchewan-provincial-nominee-program/”]

Saskatchewan Immigration Nominee Program

[/fancy_box][vc_column_text]

Saskatchewan’s Immigrant Nominee Program includes the following three categories; International Skilled Worker, Saskatchewan Experience, and Entrepreneur and Farm.

[/vc_column_text][/item][item simple_slider_bg_image_position=”default” simple_slider_overlay_strength=”0.3″ id=”1653917829874-6″ tab_id=”1653917829875-3″ title=”Item”][fancy_box box_style=”image_above_text_underline” image_url=”7228″ image_aspect_ratio=”16-9″ link_new_tab=”true” border_radius=”10px” image_loading=”default” min_height=”350″ link_url=”https://www.elaarimmigration.ca/newbrunswick-provincial-nominee-program/” link_screen_reader=”Express Entry Page”]

New Brunswick Provincial Nominee Program (NBPNP)

[/fancy_box][vc_column_text]

New Brunswick’s provincial nominee program was designed for foreign nationals who possess the necessary skills and background to contribute to the province’s economy.

[/vc_column_text][/item][item simple_slider_bg_image_position=”default” simple_slider_overlay_strength=”0.3″ id=”1653917829807-3″ tab_id=”1653917829812-4″ title=”Item”][fancy_box box_style=”image_above_text_underline” image_url=”7229″ image_aspect_ratio=”16-9″ border_radius=”10px” image_loading=”default” min_height=”350″ link_url=”https://www.elaarimmigration.ca/newfoundland-provincial-nominee-program/” link_screen_reader=”Express Entry Page”]

Newfoundland and Labrador Provincial Nominee Program

[/fancy_box][vc_column_text]The Newfoundland Labrador (NLPNP) nominee program consists of 6 different streams: Express Entry Skilled, Skilled Worker, International Graduate, and 3 more pathways.[/vc_column_text][/item][item simple_slider_bg_image_position=”default” simple_slider_overlay_strength=”0.3″ id=”1653917830070-9″ tab_id=”1653917830071-5″ title=”Item”][fancy_box box_style=”image_above_text_underline” image_url=”7230″ image_aspect_ratio=”16-9″ link_new_tab=”true” border_radius=”10px” image_loading=”default” min_height=”350″ link_url=”https://www.elaarimmigration.ca/novascotia-provincial-nominee-program/”]

Nova Scotia Nominee Program (NSNP)

[/fancy_box][vc_column_text]

The Nova Scotia nominee program consists of nine different streams. These are: Nova Scotia Labour Market Priorities, Labour Market Priorities for Physicians, Physician, Entrepreneur and 5 more pathways.
[/vc_column_text][/item][item simple_slider_bg_image_position=”default” simple_slider_overlay_strength=”0.3″ id=”1653917829751-2″ tab_id=”1653917829752-6″ title=”Item”][fancy_box box_style=”image_above_text_underline” image_url=”7233″ image_aspect_ratio=”16-9″ link_new_tab=”true” border_radius=”10px” image_loading=”default” min_height=”350″ link_url=”https://www.elaarimmigration.ca/princeedwardisland-provincial-nominee-program/” link_screen_reader=”Express Entry Page”]

Prince Edward Island Provincial Nominee Program (PEI PNP)

[/fancy_box][vc_column_text]

Prince Edward Island’s Provincial Nominee Program consists of the following streams; Critical Worker Stream, Skilled Worker Stream and, International Graduate Stream.

[/vc_column_text][/item][item simple_slider_bg_image_position=”default” simple_slider_overlay_strength=”0.3″ id=”1653917829983-8″ tab_id=”1653917829984-10″ title=”Item”][fancy_box box_style=”image_above_text_underline” image_url=”7236″ image_aspect_ratio=”16-9″ link_new_tab=”true” border_radius=”10px” image_loading=”default” min_height=”350″ link_url=”https://www.elaarimmigration.ca/yukon-provincial-nominee-program/”]

Yukon Provincial Nominee Program (YPNP)

[/fancy_box][vc_column_text]

Yukon offers the following Provincial Nominee Program streams; Critical Impact Worker, Skilled Worker, and Express Entry.

[/vc_column_text][/item][item simple_slider_bg_image_position=”default” simple_slider_overlay_strength=”0.3″ id=”1653917829931-9″ tab_id=”1653917829932-1″ title=”Item”][fancy_box box_style=”image_above_text_underline” image_url=”7231″ image_aspect_ratio=”16-9″ link_new_tab=”true” border_radius=”10px” image_loading=”default” min_height=”350″ link_url=”https://www.elaarimmigration.ca/northwestterritories-provincial-nominee-program/”]

Northwest Territories Nominee Program (NTNP)

[/fancy_box][vc_column_text]

Canada’s Northwest Territories offer two Provincial Nominee Program streams; Business Stream and Employer-Driven Stream.

[/vc_column_text][/item][/carousel][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row type=”full_width_content” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” bg_color=”#f8f8f8″ scene_position=”center” top_padding=”0″ bottom_padding=”0″ left_padding_desktop=”0″ right_padding_desktop=”0″ bottom_padding_phone=”0″ left_padding_phone=”0″ right_padding_phone=”0″ text_color=”dark” text_align=”left” row_border_radius=”none” row_border_radius_applies=”bg” overlay_strength=”0.3″ gradient_direction=”left_to_right” shape_divider_position=”bottom” bg_image_animation=”none” shape_type=””][vc_column column_padding=”padding-7-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_custom_heading text=”Who should apply for Canadian Provincial Nominee Program (PNP)?” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1668605185260{margin-top: 20px !important;}”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1668605162857{margin-top: 20px !important;}”]Each provincial nominee program targets specific types of individuals. This includes:

  • Skilled or Semi-skilled workers that possess a job offer
  • Individuals with past study or work experience in the province
  • Individuals that intend to work in occupations that are in demand under the PNP
  • Entrepreneurs
[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row type=”full_width_content” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” bg_color=”#ffffff” scene_position=”center” top_padding=”0″ bottom_padding=”0″ left_padding_desktop=”0″ right_padding_desktop=”0″ bottom_padding_phone=”0″ left_padding_phone=”0″ right_padding_phone=”0″ text_color=”dark” text_align=”left” row_border_radius=”none” row_border_radius_applies=”bg” overlay_strength=”0.3″ gradient_direction=”left_to_right” shape_divider_position=”bottom” bg_image_animation=”none” shape_type=””][vc_column column_padding=”padding-7-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_custom_heading text=”Types of Canada PNP Streams” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1668605289276{margin-top: 20px !important;}”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1668610612904{margin-top: 20px !important;}”]Canadian Provincial Nominee Program falls under two broad categories:[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”bottom” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” top_padding=”5%” text_align=”left”][vc_column_inner column_padding=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”30px” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_custom_heading text=”1. Express Entry Aligned PNPs” font_container=”tag:h3|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1654155675937{margin-bottom: 40px !important;}”][vc_column_text]

Applicants applying through an Express Entry aligned PNP must have an active profile in Canada’s Express Entry pool. This means that they should be eligible for one of the federal immigration programs, i.e. Federal Skilled Worker Program (FSWP), Federal Skilled Trades Program (FSTP) or the Canadian Experience Class (CEC). Those who manage to receive a nomination from their chosen province will receive an additional 600 points on their CRS score in the Express Entry pool. This greatly boosts their chance of receiving an Invitation to Apply(ITA).

[/vc_column_text][image_with_animation animation=”Fade In” hover_animation=”none” alignment=”” border_radius=”none” box_shadow=”none” image_loading=”default” max_width=”100%” max_width_mobile=”default”][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”bottom” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” text_align=”left”][vc_column_inner column_padding=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”30px” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_custom_heading text=”2. Non-Express Entry Aligned PNPs” font_container=”tag:h3|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1654156271637{margin-bottom: 40px !important;}”][vc_column_text]

Applicants applying through the non-Express Entry aligned PNPs do not need an Express Entry profile when applying. This option is great for applicants who do not qualify for Express Entry.

[/vc_column_text][image_with_animation animation=”Fade In” hover_animation=”none” alignment=”” border_radius=”none” box_shadow=”none” image_loading=”default” max_width=”100%” max_width_mobile=”default”][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”bottom” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” text_align=”left”][vc_column_inner column_padding=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”30px” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_custom_heading text=”Another way to categorize for Canada PNP” font_container=”tag:h3|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1668610638177{margin-bottom: 40px !important;}”][vc_column_text]

Canadian Provincial nominee programs can also be categorized into one of three types.

  • Job offer PNPs: These require applicants to have a valid job offer from a Canadian employer in their chosen province.
  • Past Study or Work PNPs: These programs are for applicants that have studied or have past work experience in the province.
  • Occupation in Demand PNPs: These programs are for applicants outside Canada working in occupations deemed in-demand by the province. Some of these programs may not require a job offer.
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1654156658547{margin-top: 20px !important;}”]In addition to the above, different PNP streams can also be classified as:

  • First Come, First Serve: PNP programs operating on a First Come, First Serve basis accept and process applications in the order that they receive them. They continue accepting applications until their quota is met.
  • Expression of Interest: Applicants applying through the Expression of Interest PNP programs are required to first submit an Expression of Interest. In these PNP programs, they have to wait for an invitation from the respective province or territory based on the applicable eligibility criteria before applying for provincial nomination.
  • Base Streams: These PNP programs do not operate using the Express Entry system.
[/vc_column_text][image_with_animation animation=”Fade In” hover_animation=”none” alignment=”” border_radius=”none” box_shadow=”none” image_loading=”default” max_width=”100%” max_width_mobile=”default”][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row type=”full_width_content” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” bg_color=”#f7f7f7″ scene_position=”center” top_padding=”5%” left_padding_desktop=”8%” right_padding_desktop=”8%” left_padding_phone=”7%” right_padding_phone=”7%” text_color=”dark” text_align=”left” row_border_radius=”none” row_border_radius_applies=”bg” overlay_strength=”0.3″ gradient_direction=”left_to_right” shape_divider_position=”bottom” bg_image_animation=”none” shape_type=””][vc_column column_padding=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_column_text]

Canadian Provincial Nominee Program: Step By Step Process

Applicants can apply for their chosen provincial nominee program by first applying to their chosen province for a nomination. They must then submit a permanent residence application to the Canadian federal government. The steps for doing this are outlined below:

[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”bottom” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” text_align=”left”][vc_column_inner column_padding=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”30px” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_custom_heading text=”1. Determine PNP Eligibility” font_container=”tag:h3|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1654157725758{margin-bottom: 40px !important;}”][vc_column_text]

Applicants should first determine their eligibility for the PNP program they want to apply.

[/vc_column_text][image_with_animation animation=”Fade In” hover_animation=”none” alignment=”” border_radius=”none” box_shadow=”none” image_loading=”default” max_width=”100%” max_width_mobile=”default”][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”bottom” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” text_align=”left”][vc_column_inner column_padding=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”30px” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_custom_heading text=”2. Complete a PNP Application” font_container=”tag:h3|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1654157757790{margin-bottom: 40px !important;}”][vc_column_text]Applicants must then complete a PNP application and submit it to their chosen province or territory.[/vc_column_text][image_with_animation animation=”Fade In” hover_animation=”none” alignment=”” border_radius=”none” box_shadow=”none” image_loading=”default” max_width=”100%” max_width_mobile=”default”][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”bottom” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” text_align=”left”][vc_column_inner column_padding=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”30px” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_custom_heading text=”3. Receive the Provincial Nomination Certificate” font_container=”tag:h3|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1654157788101{margin-bottom: 40px !important;}”][vc_column_text]

Successful applicants will receive a provincial nomination in the form of a certificate.

[/vc_column_text][image_with_animation animation=”Fade In” hover_animation=”none” alignment=”” border_radius=”none” box_shadow=”none” image_loading=”default” max_width=”100%” max_width_mobile=”default”][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”bottom” column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” text_align=”left”][vc_column_inner column_padding=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”30px” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_custom_heading text=”4. Submit the Permanent Residence Application” font_container=”tag:h3|text_align:left” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1654157834056{margin-bottom: 40px !important;}”][vc_column_text]Applicants can then apply for permanent residence through the Federal government. Applicants that have used a provincial nomination program aligned with the Express Entry system must apply through Express Entry.[/vc_column_text][image_with_animation animation=”Fade In” hover_animation=”none” alignment=”” border_radius=”none” box_shadow=”none” image_loading=”default” max_width=”100%” max_width_mobile=”default”][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row type=”full_width_content” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”default” equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”bottom” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” scene_position=”center” top_padding=”5%” bottom_padding=”5%” left_padding_desktop=”8%” right_padding_desktop=”8%” top_padding_phone=”10%” bottom_padding_phone=”10%” left_padding_phone=”7%” right_padding_phone=”7%” text_color=”dark” text_align=”left” row_border_radius=”none” row_border_radius_applies=”bg” overlay_strength=”1″ gradient_direction=”left_to_right” shape_divider_position=”bottom” bg_image_animation=”none” shape_type=””][vc_column column_padding=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_custom_heading text=”How COLOSSUS can help you?” use_theme_fonts=”yes” css=”.vc_custom_1651216426087{margin-bottom: 40px !important;}”][vc_column_text]Applicants who are planning to apply for Canadian immigration via provincial nominee programs may be overwhelmed by the 80+ program choices available. In addition to this, they may require assistance with completing their application and receiving a nomination from their chosen province.

Prospective immigrants looking for assistance with choosing the right program can Book a consultation with our licensed professionals. Our expert immigration consultants can assess your unique background and recommend the right program for you. They can also ensure your application is completed correctly before submitting it to the provincial and Federal governments. Get started with your provincial nominee program application today.[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”No Line” custom_height=”20px”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row type=”full_width_content” full_screen_row_position=”middle” column_margin=”none” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” bg_color=”#fafafa” scene_position=”center” top_padding=”0″ bottom_padding=”0″ left_padding_desktop=”0″ right_padding_desktop=”0″ top_padding_tablet=”0″ bottom_padding_tablet=”0″ left_padding_tablet=”0″ right_padding_tablet=”0″ top_padding_phone=”0″ bottom_padding_phone=”0″ left_padding_phone=”0″ right_padding_phone=”0″ text_color=”dark” text_align=”left” row_border_radius=”none” row_border_radius_applies=”bg” id=”faqs” overlay_strength=”0.3″ gradient_direction=”left_to_right” shape_divider_position=”bottom” bg_image_animation=”none” shape_type=””][vc_column column_padding=”padding-7-percent” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” tablet_text_alignment=”default” phone_text_alignment=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_column_text]

FAQs: Canadian Provincial Nominee Program

Here are some frequently asked about about the Canadian Provincial Nominee Program.[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”No Line”][vc_row_inner column_margin=”default” column_direction=”default” column_direction_tablet=”default” column_direction_phone=”default” text_align=”left”][vc_column_inner column_padding=”no-extra-padding” column_padding_tablet=”inherit” column_padding_phone=”inherit” column_padding_position=”all” column_element_spacing=”default” background_color_opacity=”1″ background_hover_color_opacity=”1″ column_shadow=”none” column_border_radius=”none” column_link_target=”_self” gradient_direction=”left_to_right” overlay_strength=”0.3″ width=”1/1″ tablet_width_inherit=”default” bg_image_animation=”none” border_type=”simple” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][toggles style=”default”][toggle color=”Default” title=”Who is eligible for Canada PNP?”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1654158101411{padding-top: 20px !important;padding-right: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 20px !important;padding-left: 20px !important;}”]Each Canadian province has its own requirements for its PNP streams. These requirements are usually based on work experience, education, and language skills. Some streams may have additional requirements such as minimum funds, valid job offer, or the intention to open or acquire a business in the province.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Default” title=”How much CRS score is required for PNP Canada?”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1654158768252{padding-top: 20px !important;padding-right: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 20px !important;padding-left: 20px !important;}”]Saskatchewan’s International Skilled Worker stream offers the easiest immigration pathway for immigrants who speak English or French, possess one year of work experience, and have completed post-secondary education.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Default” title=”How long does it take to get PNP in Canada?”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1654158791729{padding-top: 20px !important;padding-right: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 20px !important;padding-left: 20px !important;}”]Receiving your nomination from a province or territory typically takes 60 days. The following steps can be completed within 8 months. This means it takes a total of 10 months to get PNP in Canada.[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Default” title=”What is paper-based PNP?”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1654158817322{padding-top: 20px !important;padding-right: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 20px !important;padding-left: 20px !important;}”]The paper-based PNP process involves receiving a nomination certification from your chosen province or territory. Applicants can then apply for PR status via Immigration, Refugees, and Citizenship Canada (IRCC)[/vc_column_text][/toggle][toggle color=”Default” title=”Can you apply for PNP without a job offer?”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1654158898499{padding-top: 20px !important;padding-right: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 20px !important;padding-left: 20px !important;}”]Yes. Many PNP streams do not require applicants to possess a job offer. This includes:

  • Alberta PNP via Express Entry.
  • Saskatchewan Immigrant Nominee Program (SINP)
  • Ontario Immigration Nominee Program (OINP)
  • Quebec Skilled Worker Program (QSWP)
  • Nova Scotia Nominee Program (NSNP)
  • Prince Edward Island PNP via Express Entry
